question: In a certain code language, ‘HUNT’ is coded as ‘9876’ and ‘USER’ is coded as ‘4361’. What is the code for ‘U’ in that language?
solution:
(a)
H U N T → 9 8 7 6 … (i)
U S E R → 4 3 6 1 … (ii)
from (i) and (ii) ‘U’ and ‘6’ are common.
Hence, the code for ‘U’ is ‘6’.

question: If ‘A’ stands for ‘÷’, ‘B’ stands for ‘×’, ‘C’ stands for ‘+’ and ‘D’ stands for ‘–’, then the resultant of which of the following will be 59?
solution:
(a) After checking all the options one by one, only option (a) satisfies.
22 B 6 D 190 A 2 C 22
After interchanging letter with sign we get
22 × 6 - 190 ÷ 2 + 22
132 - 95 + 22 = 59

question: 99 is related to 77.3 following a certain logic. Following the same logic, 84.4 is related to 62.7. To which of the following is 72.6 related, following the same logic?
If 15 January 2019 was a Tuesday, then what day of the week was it on 29 January 2020?
solution:
(c) 15 January 2019 is Tuesday. On going to 2020 the number of odd day = 1.
We have reached till 15 January 2020, we have to reach till 29 January, the number of days between = 14. Total number of odd days = 14 + 1 = 15. On dividing 15 by 7 we get remainder = 1 . Tuesday + 1 = Wednesday.

question:
In the following number-pairs, the second number is obtained by applying certain mathematical operations to the first number. In three of the four pairs, the same pattern is applied and hence they form a group. Select the number-pair that DOES NOT belong to this group.
(NOTE : Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into their constituent digits. E.g. 13 – Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)
In which year did Indian Railways start its first computerized reservation in New Delhi?
solution: (d) 1986. Facts about the Indian Railways: First railway workshop established at Jamalpur in Bihar. Maximum number of routes emerges from Mathura Junction. Pir Pranjal is India’s longest rail tunnel. Howrah Junction is the busiest railway station.

question: In a 100 m Relay Race, how many athletes have to complete a race?
solution: (c) 4. Relay Race: Team of four athletes run equal distances, passing a baton. Last runner is the 'anchor'. The two relay races in the Olympics are the 4x100m and 4x400m for both men and women and mixed.

question: The Ramakrishna Mission was founded by _________ to regenerate Indian society by promoting the Vedanta philosophy.
solution: (a) Swami Vivekananda (Real name - Narendranath Dutt). He founded the Ramakrishna mission in 1897. Ramkrishna Paramhamsa was the guru of Vivekananda. Swami Dayananda Saraswati: Founder of Arya Samaj in 1875. Debendranath Tagore: Founder of Tattvabodhini Sabha in 1839. Raja Rammohan Roy: Founder of the Brahmo Sabha in 1828.

question: In which year did Robert Brown observe the zigzag movement of colloidal particles in solution?
solution: (b) 1827. Robert Brown observed the zigzag movement of colloidal particles, known as Brownian motion. This phenomenon involves the random movement of particles suspended in a fluid, caused by collisions with fast atoms or molecules in the gas or liquid. Brownian motion provided important evidence for the kinetic theory of heat and the existence of atoms and molecules.

question: The Manipuri dance of north-eastern India is grown out of the ritual worship of Lord _________ .
solution: (b) Krishna. Manipuri dance incorporates both the Tandava and Lasya. Dances and related God: Bharatanatyam (Lord Shiva), Mohiniattyam (Lord Vishnu).

question: When is World Population Day observed ?
solution: (c) 11th July. World Population Day, established by the United Nations in 1989, serves as an important platform to raise awareness about global population issues. The theme for 2024, "Leave no one behind, count everyone”.

question: Which of the following was first introduced in bacterial cells by the American molecular biologist Joshua Lederberg in 1952?
solution: (c) Plasmid. They are separate DNA molecules in bacteria, capable of independent replication from chromosomal DNA. They are double-stranded and circular, occurring naturally in bacteria and sometimes in eukaryotic organisms. Plasmid sizes range from 1 to over 1,000 kilobase pairs (kbp).

question: Which of the following pairs is correctly matched?
solution: (a) Third man – Cricket. Sports Terminologies: Cricket - Belter, Dolly, Duck, Leg-Before Wicket (LBW), Leg-bye, Maiden. Field Hockey - Flick, Jink, Long corner, Scoop, Sweep hit. Basketball - Charging, Dunk, Hook shot, Layup, Point guard, Sixth man.

question: Which of the following parts of the Indian Constitution is related to amendment of the Constitution?
solution: (d) Part XX. Article 368 in Part XX of the Constitution deals with the power of parliament to amend the constitution and its procedures. It provides for two types of amendments: By a special majority of Parliament, and By a special majority of the Parliament along with the ratification of half of the states legislatures by a simple majority. In the Kesavananda Bharati case (1973), the Supreme Court ruled that the Parliament cannot amend those provisions which form the ‘basic structure’ of the Constitution.

question: The Dronacharya award is given to _________.
solution: (a) Best coach. The Dronacharya Award was instituted in 1985. This award is given by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, for excellence in sports coaching. The first recipients of the award - Bhalchandra Bhaskar Bhagwat (Wrestling), Om Prakash Bhardwaj (Boxing), and O. M. Nambiar (Athletics). The first woman to win the Dronacharya Award was weightlifting coach Hansa Sharma in 2000.

question: Which of the following two quantities have the same dimensions?
solution: (a) Work and torque. Both work and torque have the same dimensions, expressed as [ML2T−2]. This is because both work and torque can be represented as the product of force and distance, with work defined as force times displacement (W = F⋅d) and torque defined as force times the perpendicular distance from the pivot point (τ = F⋅r). Since force has dimensions of [MLT−2], both work and torque ultimately have the same dimensional expression.

question: Chandertal, Renuka and Pong Dam are the three Ramsar wetland sites of which state?
solution: (d) Himachal Pradesh. The Ramsar Convention: It was adopted in the Iranian city of Ramsar in 1971 and came into force in 1975. India joined it in 1982. Some Ramsar sites in India: Chitrangudi Bird Sanctuary and Karikili Bird Sanctuary (Tamil Nadu), Bakhira Sanctuary and Haiderpur Wetland (Uttar Pradesh), Thol Lake and Wadhvana Wetland (Gujarat), Ranganathittu Bird Sanctuary (Karnataka).

question: _____ is an asset that the borrower owns (such as land, buildings, vehicles, livestock, bank deposits) and uses as a guarantee to the lender until the loan is repaid.
solution: (b) Collateral. Every loan agreement specifies an interest rate that the borrower must pay to the lender along with the repayment of the principal. Additionally, lenders may require collateral (security) against loans. If the borrower fails to repay the loan, the lender has the right to sell the asset or collateral to recover the payment. Liabilities are obligations or debts that an enterprise has to pay at some time in the future.

question: Who launched the "VISION Portal" in November 2024, aimed at nurturing skill development in underprivileged children?
solution: (c) Dr. Jitendra Singh. The "VISION Portal," focuses on providing skill development opportunities to underprivileged children. This initiative aims to bridge the skill gap and empower youth for better career prospects.

question: Who among the following artists received the Padma Shri award in 2021 for his contribution to keep alive the tribal folk dance ‘Gussadi’ ?
solution: (d) Kanaka Raju. Gusadi is a folk dance performed by ‘Raj Gonds’ or the Gondulu tribes in the Adilabad district of Telangana. The dance is generally performed during the festival of Diwali. Gaddam Padmaja Reddy - Kuchipudi exponent. Gopal Prasad Dubey - Padma Shri (2012) for his contribution in the field of Chhau dance. R Muthukannammal - A Sadhir dancer who got the Padma Shri in 2022.

question: The method of separating a mixture of soluble solids by dissolving them in a suitable hot solvent and then lowering the temperature slowly is called :
solution: (d) fractional crystallisation. Azeotropic distillation is the process of separating all the components of an azeotropic mixture by the process of distillation. Sublimation is the change of solid state directly to gaseous state without going through liquid state.

question: What does CJI stand for?
solution: (a) Chief Justice of India (CJI) is the highest-ranking officer of the Indian judiciary and serves as the chief judge of the Supreme Court of India. The Chief Justice of India and the Judges of the Supreme Court are appointed by the President under Article 124(2). The appointed chief justice will serve until they reach the age of 65 or are removed through the constitutional process of impeachment.

question: Which of the following rivers is known as Dakshin Ganga?
solution: (d) Godavari is the largest peninsular river of India. It rises from Trimbakeshwar in the Nashik district of Maharashtra and drains into Bay of Bengal. Its length is 1465 km. It is also the second largest river in India after Ganga. Principal Tributaries - Pravara, Purna, Manjra, Penganga, Wardha, Wainganga, Pranhita (combined flow of Wainganga, Penganga, Wardha), Indravati, Maner and Sabri.

question: Tipu Sultan became the ruler of Mysore in_______.
solution: (b) 1782. Tipu Sultan (The Tiger of Mysore) was the ruler of the Kingdom of Mysore (Karnataka) which he inherited from his father Hyder Ali. He was a pioneer of rocket artillery. On the 4th of May 1799, Tipu Sultan was killed, fighting the British East India Company Army.

question: Kirti Kisan Party (KKP) was established on ______ at Amritsar.
solution: (c) 12th April 1927. The ideal of the Kirti Kisan Party (KKP) was to establish a socialist republic. This party had Marxist leanings and possessed one of the biggest political networks in rural Punjab during the 1930s and the 40s.

question: Which of the following currency note was discarded by the Government of India in November 2016?
solution: (a) ₹500. In India, currency notes of ₹500 and ₹1,000 were declared invalid in 2016. The Government of India announced the demonetisation on 8 November 2016. Government-issued new ₹500 and ₹2,000 currency notes soon after the demonetisation. The newly redesigned series of banknotes ₹500 and ₹2,000 were in circulation since 10 November 2016. The issuance of the currency is controlled by the Reserve Bank of India.

question: Rickets is caused by deficiency of:
solution: (b) Vitamin D. Rickets is a childhood disorder caused by a deficiency of vitamin D, calcium or phosphate. Vitamin B deficiency: Causes Beriberi, Pellagra or Anemia. Vitamin C deficiency: Leads to Scurvy (bleeding gums, poor wound healing). Vitamin A deficiency: Causes night blindness, weakened immunity, and skin issues.

question: A small object is placed on the focus on the left side of a convex lens. Where will be the image formed?
option_1: At the centre on the right side of the lens.
option_2: At infinity on the left side of the lens.
option_3: At infinity on the right side of the lens.
option_4: At the focus on the right side of the lens.
solution: (c) At infinity on the right side of the lens. Object Position Image Formation by Convex Lens: When an object is placed at the focus (F) of a convex lens, its image is formed at infinity. If the object is between F and 2F, the image is real, inverted, and magnified. At 2F, the image is real, inverted, and the same size as the object. Beyond 2F, the image is real, inverted, and reduced. An object at infinity forms an image at the focus (F) of the lens.

question: 49 What is India’s score in the AI Preparedness Index 2024?
solution: (a) 0.49. India ranks 72nd out of 174 countries in the AI Preparedness Index. This report is released by the International Monetary Fund. The index evaluates a country’s AI readiness based on four pillars: digital infrastructure, human capital, technological innovation, and legal frameworks. Singapore holds the top rank with a score of 0.80.

question: ‘My Days’ is an autobiography written by whom among the following authors?
solution: (b) RK Narayan. His other books: “Malgudi Days”, “Swami and Friends”, ”The Guide”, “The Vendor of Sweets”, “The Dark Room”, and “The Bachelor of Arts”.

question: If 3sin2θ + 5cos2θ = 4 and θ is an acute angle, then the value of tanθ is:
solution:
(d)
3sin2θ + 5cos2θ = 4
⇒ 3(sin2θ + cos2θ) + 2cos2θ = 4
⇒ 2cos2θ = 1
⇒ cosθ = 12
⇒ θ = 45°
∴ tanθ = tan 45° = 1

question: The population of the village was 130,000. It increased by 10% in the first year and increased by 25% in the second year. Its population after two years is _______.
solution:
(c)
Population after 2 years
= 130000 × 1110 × 54
= 178750

question: Given that 260.89 = x, 260.31 = y and xz = y2 , then the value of z is close to:
solution:
(b)
[260.89 = x and 260.31 = y] -------(i)
Also, xz = y2-------(ii)
Putting the value of x and y from equation (i) to (ii) we get;
260.89 × z = 260.31 × 2
Comparing power both sides
(0.89)z = (0.31) × 2
89z = 62
z = 6289 = 0.7

question: Pipes P and Q can completely fill a water tank in 10 hours and 15 hours, respectively. A pipe R can empty a tank filled completely with water in 12 hours. Initially, the tank is empty and only pipes P and Q are opened at 6 a.m. and pipe R is also opened at 9 a.m. By what time will the tank be completely filled?
solution:
(d)

P and Q worked for three hours = 10 × 3 = 30 units
Remaining work = 60 - 30 = 30 units
Time taken by all pipes for remaining work = 306+4-5 = 6 hrs
⇒ the tank will be completely filled at 9am + 6 hrs = 3 pm

question: In a division problem, the divisor is 4 times the quotient and 2 times the remainder. If the remainder is 32, then find the dividend.
solution:
(a) According to the question,
Remainder = 32
Divisor = 4 × quotient
Divisor = 2 × remainder = 2 × 32 = 64
So, divisor = 64 , quotient = 16
⇒ dividend = divisor × quotient + remainder
⇒ dividend = 64 × 16 + 32 = 1056

question: A shopkeeper buys oranges at the rate of 10 oranges for ₹50 and sells them at the rate of 12 oranges for ₹74. Find his gain or loss percentage.
solution:
(a)
C.P. of one orange = 5010 = 5
S.P. of one orange = 7412
Profit % = 7412 - 55 × 100
= 1460 × 100 = 703% = 2313%

percentage increase in annual profit of the departmental store from 1997 to 2000
= 770-410410 × 100
= 360041 = 873341%

question:
What is the area of a quadrilateral ABCD. (shown below) in which sides AB and BC are equal, sides AD and CD are of lengths 5 cm and 13 cm, respectively, and side AD is perpendicular to the diagonal AC ?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1741072362516.png
solution:
(a)

△DAC is right triangle. Then, AC = 132-52 = 144 = 12 cm
AE = EC = 6 cm (△BCE ≅ △BAE)
Now, △BEC is right triangle. Then, BE = 102-62 = 64 = 8 cm
Area of quadrilateral = area of (△ABC) + area of (△ADC)
= 12 × BE × AC + 12 × AD × AC
= 12 × AC(BE + AD)
= 12 × 12(8 + 5)
= 78 cm2

question: If x = 11 , then the value of (x5 -12x4 + 12x3 - 12x2 + 12x -1)
solution:
(a) x5 -12x4 + 12x3 - 12x2 + 12x -1
x5 -11x4 - x4 + 11x3 + x3 - 11x2 - x2 + 11x + x -1
Now, x = 11 ….(given)
On putting value of 11 as x , we get
x5 - x × x4 - x4 + x × x3 + x3 - x × x2 - x2 + x × x + x -1
x5 - x5 - x4 + x4 + x3 - x3 - x2 + x2 + x - 1
⇒ x - 1 = 11 - 1 = 10

question: The length of the largest possible rod that can be placed in a cubical room is 423 m. The surface area (in m²) of the largest possible sphere that fit within the cubical room is: [Use π = 227]
solution:
(d)
Length of the largest possible rod which can be placed in cubical room = 3a
423 = 3a
a = 42
Required TSA of sphere = 4 × 227 × (422)2 = 5544 m2

question: (The smallest common multiple of 16, 24 and 36) ÷ (the largest common factor of 16, 24 and 36) is equal to:
solution:
(a)
The LCM of 16, 24 and 36 = 24 × 32 = 144
The HCF of 16, 24 and 36 = 22 = 4
According to question,
144 ÷ 4 = 36.

question: In what ratio must Suhail, a wholesaler, mix wheat worth ₹45 per kg with wheat worth ₹75 per kg, so that by selling the mixture at ₹80 per kg, he may gain 25%?
solution:
(b) Selling price of the mixture = ₹80/kg , Gain = 25%
Cost price of the mixture = Selling price1+Gain percentage​ = 801+0.25​ ​= 801.25​ ​​= ₹64 per kg
Cheaper wheat = ₹45/kg
Costlier wheat = ₹75/kg

Required ratio = 11 : 19

question: The resistance of a wire is directly proportional to its length and inversely proportional to the square of its radius. (b) According to question
Resistance (R) ∝ Length radius 2
R = klr2 …. (i)
r1r2 = 78
⇒ k(147)49 = k(L)64
⇒ L = 147×6449 = 192cm

question: P and Q together can complete a work in 30 days. Q and R together can complete the same work in 37.5 days. R and P together can complete the same work in 150 days. In how many days can all the three complete the same work while working together ?
solution:
(d)

Efficiency (P + Q + R) = 25+20+52 = 502 = 25 unit
Time taken by all of them to complete the whole work = 75025 = 30 days

question: If sin θ = 1112, then what will be the value of (tanθ + secθ) ?
solution:
(c)
sin θ = 1112 = ph
b = (12)2-(11)2
b = 144-121 = 23
According to the question,
⇒ (tanθ + secθ) = pb + hb = p+hb
⇒ 11+1223 = 2323 = 23

question: A man walks to a viewpoint and returns to the starting point by his car maintaining constant speed and thus takes a total time of 6 hours 15 minutes. He would have gained 2 hours by driving both ways. How long would it have taken for him to walk both ways with the same walking speed ?
solution:
(d)
Let the distance = x km,
walking’s speed = w km/h
and car’s speed = c km/h
According to question,
⇒ xw + xc = 614 = 254 ……(i)
⇒ 2xc = 414 = 174
⇒ xc = 178
Putting the above value in equation (i)
⇒ xw + 178 = 254
⇒ xw = 254 - 178
⇒ xw = 50-178 = 338 hours
Time taken by walking both way = 2 × 338 = 334 = 8 hours 15 minutes

question: From the top and bottom of 200 m high building, the angles of elevation of the top of a tower are 30° and 45° respectively. What is the height (in m) of the tower?
solution:
(c)

Given , CD = 200m , BE = 200 m , AE = x meter
In triangle ABC
tanθ = ABBC
tan45° = 200+xBC
1 = 200+x BC
BC = 200 + x
ED = BC = 200 + x
Then , triangle AED
tanθ = AEED
tan 30° = x 200+x
1√3= x 200+x
x= 200(3-1)
x = 100(3 +1)
Hence ,
AB = 200 + x
= 200 + 1003+100
= 300 + 1003
= 1003 (3+1)


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1741072363291.png

question: 400 oranges were bought at ₹1410 per hundred and were sold at a profit of ₹960. Find the selling price (in ₹) per dozen of oranges.
solution:
(d) According to question,
CP of 100 oranges = 1410
CP of 400 oranges = 1410100 × 400 = ₹ 5640
SP of 400 oranges = 5640 + 960 = ₹ 6600
SP of 1 dozen oranges = 6600400 × 12 = ₹ 198

question: Side BC of a ∆ABC is extended upto D such that CD = AC. If ∠BAD = 118° and ∠ACB = 80°, then the value of ∠ABC is equal to:
solution:
(c)

∠ACD = 180 - 80 = 100° [sum of angles at one side of linear line is 180°]
Side, AC = CD
Then, ∠CAD = ∠ADC
In ΔCAD
2∠CAD + 100° = 180°
∠CAD = 40°
Now, ∠BAC = 118 - 40 = 78°
In ΔABC
∠BAC + ∠ACB + ∠CBA = 180°
78° + 80° + ∠ABC = 180°
∠ABC = 22°


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1741072363486.png

question: The price of an article is first increased by 40% and then decreased by 45%, due to reduction in sales. Find the net percentage change in the final price of the article.
solution:
(a)
%Change = 40 - 45 + 40×(-45)100 = - 23%

question: Find the surface area (in cm²) of a cardboard box in the shape of a cuboid whose length is 60 cm, breadth is half its length and height is one-third of its breadth.
solution:
(d)
Length of cuboid = 60 cm
Breadth of cuboid = 60 × 12 = 30 cm
Height of cuboid = 13 × 30 = 10 cm
TSA of cardboard box = 2(lb + bh + hl)
= 2(60 × 30 + 30 × 10 + 10 × 60)
= 2(1800 + 300 + 600)
= 2 × 2700
= 5400 cm2

question: A part of ₹48,500 is invested at a simple interest of 15% per annum. The rest of the money is invested at the rate of 10% simple interest per annum after 2 years of the first investment. The ratio of interest after 5 years from the time when the first amount was invested is 5 : 3. How much is the second part that was invested( in ₹) at the rate of 10% simple interest ?
solution:
(b)
Let 1st part be x and 2nd part be y
x is invested for 5 years and y is invested for 3 years
Interest for x in 5 years = 5 × 15% = 75%
Interest for y in 3 years = 3 × 10% = 30%
According to question
75% of x30% of y = 53
xy = 5×303×75 = 23
Now second part (y) = 35 × 48,500 = ₹ 29100

question: The average of 12 numbers is 48. The average of the first 5 numbers is 45 and the average of next 4 numbers is 52. If the 10th number is 10 less than the 11th number and is 5 more than the 12th number, then the average of the 11th and 12th numbers is:
solution:
(d)
Sum of last three numbers = 12 × 48 - 5 × 45 - 4 × 52 = 143
10th number = x + 5
11th number = x + 15
12th number = x
⇒ x + 5 + x + 15 + x = 143
⇒ 3x + 20 = 143
⇒ x = 41
Hence, average of 11th and 12th number = 2(41)+152 = 48.5

question: What will be the remainder when 1112024 is divided by 11?
solution:
(c)
Divisibility of 11 :- the difference of the sum of digits at odd position and sum of digits at even position in a number is 0 or multiple of 11 then the number divisible by 11.
Given number: 1112024
Difference = (4 + 0 + 1 + 1) - (2 + 2 + 1 + 1) = 0
Hence, required no. = 1

question:
The following table shows the production of cars in a company from 2016 to 2020.

There was a continuous increase in the production of cars of which type during the period 2016 to 2020?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1741072363751.png
solution: (c) We can clearly see that the production of year c is continuously increasing.

question:
Parts of the following sentence have been underlined and given as options. Select the option that contains an error.
If it will rain tomorrow, I will stay at home.
solution:
(c) will rain
‘Will rain’ must be replaced with ‘rains’. The given sentence is an example of the first conditional sentence and the correct grammatical structure is “if + Simple present……. Sub + will +V1”. Hence, ‘If it rains’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Find a word that is the synonym of Imminent
solution:
(c) Impending- something that will happen soon
Imminent- almost certain to happen very soon
Unyielding- unlikely to be swayed or resolute.
Ignorant- not knowing about something
Distant- a long way away in space or time

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can replace the bracketed word segment in the following sentence.
Children should avoid giving out personal details online (which will) identify them or their location.
solution:
(a) that could
‘Could’ is used to indicate possibility. The given sentence states an advice to children that they should avoid giving out personal details online that could identify them or their location. Hence, ‘that could’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
From among the words given in bold, select the INCORRECTLY spelt word in the following sentence.
Kathmandu is vivid, mercenery, religious with small shrines to flower-adorned deities along the narrowest and busiest streets.
solution: (c) Mercenary is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the word which means the same as the group of words given
An omission of duty.
solution:
(b) Delinquency- An omission of duty , crime, guilt
Deliberation - means long and careful consideration or discussion.
Delineation - means the action of describing or portraying something precisely.

question:
Parts of a sentence are given below in jumbled order. Select the option that gives their correct logical sequence and forms a meaningful sentence.
The initial days / are not (P) / of my high school (Q) / to remember (R) / very good (S).
solution:
(d) Q, P, S, R
The given sentence starts with the phrase ‘The initial days’. Part Q will follow this phrase as it completes the subject. Part P contains the main verb ‘are’ of this sentence and Part S contains the complement ‘very good’ of the verb ‘are’. So, S will follow P. Part R completes the complement by stating that the initial days are not very good to remember. Going through the options, option (d) has the correct sequence.

question:
Identify the segment in the sentence, which contains an error.
In this book I came on some words the meanings of which I did not know.
solution:
(a) “came on”
Came across will be the right phrase.Came across means to meet or find something by chance.The correct sentence is - In this book I came across some words the meanings of which I did not know.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(b) marijuena
‘Marijuana’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Identify the best way to improve the underlined part of the given sentence. If there is no improvement required, select ‘no improvement’.
I can’t go out in the rain as I am not having an umbrella.
solution:
(b) don’t have an umbrella
Have is a stative verb. It means own/hold. It is not used in progressive tenses.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of idiom in the sentence.
To pay lip service
option_1: To express loyalty, respect, or support for something insincerely
solution:
(a) To pay lip service- to express loyalty, respect, or support for something insincerely.
Example.- Neha claims to be in favour of the proposal, but so far she has only paid lip service to the idea.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Priya washes her clothes in the evening.
option_1: The clothes was washed by Priya in the evening.
option_2: The clothes is washed by Priya in the evening.
option_3: The clothes are washed by Priya in the evening.
option_4: The clothes were washed by Priya in the evening.
solution:
(c) The clothes are washed by Priya in the evening.
(a) The clothes was washed by Priya in the evening. (Incorrect Tense)
(b) The clothes is washed by Priya in the evening. (Incorrect Tense)
(d) The clothes were washed by Priya in the evening. (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of idiom in the sentence.
The Chairman of our company takes care of the rank and file in the company.
solution:
(a) ordinary people
E.g.- The rank and file feel that the minister is corrupt.

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.
P. Applied arts require an object to be functional, as well as beautiful.
Q. They recognised that their work belonged to the higher social classes who had the wealth to purchase art and the leisure time to enjoy it.
R. Fine art is categorised as something which only has an aesthetic or conceptual function.
S. There are a number of different categories of objects and processes under the umbrella term of art which need to be explored.
T. In the twentieth century, artists began to challenge the established notion of art.
U. Art is typically divided into two areas: fine art (such as painting, sculpture, music and poetry), and the applied arts (such as pottery, weaving, metal working, furniture making and calligraphy).
solution:
(b) SURPTQ
Sentence S will be the starting line as it introduces the main idea of the parajumble, i.e. ‘different categories of objects and processes under the umbrella term of art’. And, Sentence U talks about the division of art into two areas- fine arts and the applied arts. So, U will follow S. Further, Sentence R describes fine art & Sentence P describes the applied arts. So, P will follow R. However, Sentence T states that artists began to challenge the established notion of art in the twentieth century & Sentence Q states their recognition that their work belonged to the higher social classes. So, Q will follow T. Going through the options, option (b) has the correct sequence.

question:
Select the word which means the same as the group of words given
A person who works in a shop that sells cut flowers and plants
solution:
(d) Florist- a person who works in a shop that sells cut flowers and plants.
Dealer - a person whose business is buying and selling things
Vendor- a person who is selling something
Hawker- someone who sells goods informally in public places

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
It took 4 hours straight to ___________ the deal with the regional company.
solution:
(c) close
‘Close’ is the correct verb to use with ‘deal’. ‘Closing the deal’ means to make a successful business arrangement with someone. Hence, ‘close’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the meaning of the underlined segment.
Partly, it may be a desire to stop emotions in front of strangers.
solution: (a) Quell- to completely stop or end something.

question:
Pick a word opposite in meaning to
Desiderate
solution:
(b) Disregard - to take no notice of somebody/something
Desiderate - feel a keen desire for something lacking or absent
Quarrel - an angry argument or disagreement
Acquire - to obtain or buy something
Mandate- the power that is officially given to a group of people to do something

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word in the given sentence.
The athlete looked unsettled before the race.
solution:
(b) Confident - feeling or showing that you are sure about your own abilities, opinions, etc.
Unsettled- nervous and worried.
Tangent- a completely different line of thought or action.
Triumphant- feeling or showing great happiness because you have won or succeeded at something
Reticent- inclined to keep one's thoughts, feelings, or opinions to oneself.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
___________ the last ten years we have been victims of abuse.
solution:
(b) For.
The given sentence is in “present perfect continuous tense” and we should use “for” according to its structure as “for” is used for a given period of time.

question:
Select the correct active form of the given sentences.
Has the villa been occupied by them?
solution:
(c) Have they occupied the villa?
(a) Did they occupied the villa? (Incorrect Tense)
(b) Had they occupied the villa? (Incorrect Tense)
(d) Do they occupied the villa? (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Cloze test:
Without water no animals can survive. In desert regions, the greatest (96)______ for living is drying up. But many creatures are able to make use of (97)______ little water that exists in arid areas. One of nature's masterpieces, (98)______ creatures equipped to (99)_______ with desert life is the hardy camel. There are several stories describing the (100)_______ endurance of these animals.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no.96
solution:
(c) requirement
‘Requirement’ means something that you need or that you must do or have. The given passage states that the greatest requirement(that you need) for living is drying up. Hence, ‘requirements’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:
Without water no animals can survive. In desert regions, the greatest (96)______ for living is drying up. But many creatures are able to make use of (97)______ little water that exists in arid areas. One of nature's masterpieces, (98)______ creatures equipped to (99)_______ with desert life is the hardy camel. There are several stories describing the (100)_______ endurance of these animals.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no.97
solution:
(b) the
We will use the definite article ‘the’ before ‘little water’ because it is a specific phrase. The given passage states that many creatures are able to make use of the little water that exists in arid areas. Hence, ‘the’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:
Without water no animals can survive. In desert regions, the greatest (96)______ for living is drying up. But many creatures are able to make use of (97)______ little water that exists in arid areas. One of nature's masterpieces, (98)______ creatures equipped to (99)_______ with desert life is the hardy camel. There are several stories describing the (100)_______ endurance of these animals.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no.98
solution:
(c) among
‘Among’ means concerning a particular group of people or things. The given passage talks about a group of creatures. Hence, ‘among’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:
Without water no animals can survive. In desert regions, the greatest (96)______ for living is drying up. But many creatures are able to make use of (97)______ little water that exists in arid areas. One of nature's masterpieces, (98)______ creatures equipped to (99)_______ with desert life is the hardy camel. There are several stories describing the (100)_______ endurance of these animals.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no.99
solution:
(d) cope
‘Cope’ means to deal successfully with a difficult matter or situation. The given passage talks about camels who can successfully deal with the difficult situations of the desert. Hence, ‘cope’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:
Without water no animals can survive. In desert regions, the greatest (96)______ for living is drying up. But many creatures are able to make use of (97)______ little water that exists in arid areas. One of nature's masterpieces, (98)______ creatures equipped to (99)_______ with desert life is the hardy camel. There are several stories describing the (100)_______ endurance of these animals.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no.100
solution:
(a) remarkable
‘Remarkable’ means worthy of being or likely to be noticed. The given passage talks about the endurance of camels which is worth to be noticed. Hence, ‘remarkable’ is the most appropriate answer.
